body_html:
I installed Bazel from the macOS installer

./bazel-0.5.2-installer-darwin-x86_64.sh --user

and I have the same problem when trying to build something (a fork of the Magenta repo, in my case):

ERROR: /private/var/tmp/_bazel_epnichols/3e6515dd3746b8d7b7b2bef4294514b6/external/protobuf/protobuf.bzl:91:19: name 'HOST_CFG' is not defined.

A bit more info:

bash bazel version

Build label: 0.5.2
Build target: bazel-out/darwin_x86_64-fastbuild/bin/src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/bazel/BazelServer_deploy.jar
Build time: Tue Jun 27 13:17:02 2017 (1498569422)
Build timestamp: 1498569422
Build timestamp as int: 1498569422

Is this actually broken in the prebuilt installer, or is it just me?

body:
I installed Bazel from the macOS installer 

`./bazel-0.5.2-installer-darwin-x86_64.sh --user`

and I have the same problem when trying to build something (a fork of the Magenta repo, in my case): 

`ERROR: /private/var/tmp/_bazel_epnichols/3e6515dd3746b8d7b7b2bef4294514b6/external/protobuf/protobuf.bzl:91:19: name 'HOST_CFG' is not defined.`

A bit more info:
```
bash bazel version

Build label: 0.5.2
Build target: bazel-out/darwin_x86_64-fastbuild/bin/src/main/java/com/google/devtools/build/lib/bazel/BazelServer_deploy.jar
Build time: Tue Jun 27 13:17:02 2017 (1498569422)
Build timestamp: 1498569422
Build timestamp as int: 1498569422
```

Is this actually broken in the prebuilt installer, or is it just me?
